document.masterDocTitle: A sea of worms: polychaete checklist of the Adriatic Sea

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A sea of worms: polychaete checklist of the Adriatic Sea

subSubSection.paragraph:
NEW
RECORDS
: BM 12 , BM 13 , BM 16 , BM 17 , BM 18 , BM 19 , BM 20 , BM 21 , BM 27 , BM 28 , BM 34 , BM 38 , BM 39 , BM 52 , BM 53 , BM 54 , BM 92 , BM 96 , BM 99 , BM 101 .

LITERATURE
RECORDS
:
Ambrogi et al . 1987
;
Crema et al . 2001
;
Castelli et al . 2008
. REMARKS : Reported for all Adriatic sectors in the polychaete checklist of the Italian seas (
Castelli et al. 2008
). However, more precise data on collecting sites in CA and SA not available.

Magelona minuta Eliason, 1962
DISTRIBUTION : NA , CA, SA.

OTHER
REPORTED NAMES
:
Magelona rosea Moore, 1907
.

REMARKS : The previous records of
Magelona rosea Moore, 1907
in the European waters are considered as doubtful and species was assigned to
M. minuta
(
Eliason 1962 b
). This is probably also the case of Adriatic records of
M. rosea
which are included under
M. minuta
.

REMARKS : The presence of
Magelona papillicornis
(species with type locality in Brazil ) in the European waters is questionable (Fiege et al. 2000 ) and these records should be assigned to
M. mirabilis (Johnston, 1865 )
and
M. johnstoni
Fiege, Licher & Mackie, 2000
. That is most probably also the case of the Adriatic records of
M. papillicornis
. However, since currently it is not possible to check to which one of the two species each Adriatic record should be assigned to, it was preferred to leave them as
M. papillicornis
. In the future, with new findings of
Magelona
specimens in the region, it will be possible to have a better idea to which of the species the records may be attributed, with a higher degree of confidence.
